citeinfo.origin: Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta
citeinfo.title: Greater Sage Grouse Range

pubinfo.publish: Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta

descript.abstract: The Greater Sage Grouse (Centrocercus urophasianus urophasianus) Range layer is an amalgamation of: the Alberta critical habitat layer and the associated buffer; the Alberta leks layer and associated buffers; and the Federal Critical Habitat layer and associated buffer.The resulting single contiguous polygon represents the general range of the Greater Sage Grouse. The "doughnut" holes in these layers are included in the sage grouse layer since radio-telemetry indicates sage grouse use these areas at various times throughout its annual life cycle.
descript.purpose: Greater Sage Grouse are an endangered species in Alberta. The purpose of this layer is to provide the general public, industrial operators and government departments information regarding the location of Greater Sage Grouse range. Specific operating conditions apply to Greater Sage Grouse range. Proponents are required to examine the range for application of setbacks.
descript.supplinf: Greater Sage Grouse Range has been endorsed by Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta. In March 2015, the Alberta critical habitat layer, leks and buffers, and the Federal Critical Habitat layer were amalgamated to make one layer (i.e., a range map).

idinfo.useconst: This material has been provided with the intent that it be readily available for personal and public non-commercial (educational) use and except where otherwise prohibited, may be reproduced, in part or in whole and by any means, without charge or further permission from the Policy and Planning Division. We only ask that: The materials not be modified, users exercise due diligence in ensuring the accuracy of the materials, the Government of Alberta be identified as the source of the materials, the reproduction is not represented as an official version of the materials reproduced, nor as having been made in affiliation with or with the endorsement of the Government of Alberta, reproduction of multiple copies of materials, in whole or in part, for the purposes of commercial distribution is prohibited, except with written permission from the Policy and Planning Division. To obtain permission to reproduce materials on this site for commercial purposes, please contact the Policy and Planning Division.

cntinfo.cntinst: This is the point of contact regarding the creation of, and characteristics of, the data set. Queries about the creation and/or characteristics of the data set submitted through facsimile or electronic mail must include the salutation "Attention: Provincial Wildlife Habitat Specialist; Dataset: Greater Sage Grouse Range". For Distribution Information contact instructions, refer to the Distribution Information section of this metadata record. For Metadata Information contact instructions, refer to the Metadata Reference Information section of this metadata record.

citeinfo.origin: Mike Suitor, Fish and Wildlife Division, Alberta Environment and Parks, Government of Alberta

procstep.procdesc: The Alberta critical habitat layer, leks and buffers, and the Federal Critical Habitat Layer were all dissolved to create one polygon that spans the range of Greater Sage Grouse in Southern Alberta. Gaps in the range were filled in and the outer boundary was smoothed in places.
